i am 77 years old . i grew up in a wealthy , all - white neighborhood in seattle . my public schools where all white with 2 asians . park league sports across the city were my only association with people of color , and they were good and respected athletes . it was clear to me as an early teen that i was only experiencing one side of society , one culture - based point of view on almost all social matters . later , i joined the navy and experienced cultural differences with men from the south . i traveled to japan , hong kong and the philippines where i was more deeply exposed to other cultures . later in life , i became associated with pacific islanders through outrigger paddling and observed many cultural attributes which brought good feelings and human appreciation . care - givers of philippine background have cared for my mother and now my mother - in - law . at this phase of my life , i am finally feeling the richness cultural diversity delivers . for me , this is one of my life's finest rewards .
